items.content: England have avoided an Ashes whitewash by winning a memorable Boxing Day Test at the MCG – their first Test win on Australian soil in almost 15 years. Follow the reaction.

clusters.title: Sydney woman, 40, allegedly tried to smuggle $13m of meth labelled as tea
clusters.neutral_headline: Sydney woman, 40, allegedly tried to smuggle $13m of meth labelled as tea
bullet_summary: The 40-year-old woman was arrested after a routine bag check at Sydney Airport found 15 kilograms of methamphetamine in her luggage

items.title: Sydney woman, 40, allegedly tried to smuggle $13m of meth labelled as tea
items.standfirst: Border Force officers stopped the 40-year-old woman, from Bonnyrigg in the city's west on Boxing Day at Sydney Airport.
items.content: A Sydney woman faces life in jail for allegedly trying to import 15kg of methamphetamine with a street value of $13 million into Australia disguised in her luggage as tea.Border Force officers stopped the 40-year-old woman from Bonnyrigg in the city's west on Boxing Day at Sydney Airport.Officers allegedly discovered 18 vacuum-sealed bags labelled as "tea" but containing "a clear crystalline substance" in her luggage.READ MORE: Aussie childcare providers call out federal government's mandateThe drugs had an estimated street value of more than $13 million and could have been sold in over 150,000 individual street deals the AFP says. The 40-year-old was charged with importing a commercial quantity of methamphetamine and faces a maximum penalty of life in prison.READ MORE: Collapsing crane leaves 91 holidaymakers locked out of caravan park for almost a week She was set to face court today. AFP Detective Superintendent Morgen Blunden said: "Trafficking drugs in your luggage, either knowingly or unknowingly, is a criminal offence, and if caught, you face losing some of the best years of your life sitting in a prison cell either in Australia or overseas.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: Woman charged after 15kg of meth labelled ‘tea’ found in luggage

items.content: The 40-year-old woman was arrested after a routine bag check at Sydney Airport found 15 kilograms of methamphetamine in her luggage.
